definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
(of a smell) strong/peak season (of a crop)/(classifier for the ordinal number of a crop, in the context of multiple harvests)

sentences.english: Graphic are good especially when you use the flame thrower.
sentences.chinese: 圖形是好的，特別是當您使用火焰噴射器。

sentences.english: Probability of blowing up a flamethrower armed soldier is reduced.
sentences.chinese: 降低裝備火焰噴射器的士兵爆炸的機率。

sentences.english: The flamethrower now has a range slider which can be altered.
sentences.chinese: 火焰噴射器現在有一系列的滑塊可改變。

sentences.english: A flamethrower is just an attention-getter.
sentences.chinese: 一架火焰噴射器又太扎眼。

sentences.english: Fixed not being able to reflect arrows with the Flamethrower.
sentences.chinese: 修正無法使用火焰噴射器反彈箭矢的錯誤。

sentences.english: It works by pressing a button on the handlebar.
sentences.chinese: 只要一按車把手上的按鈕，火焰噴射器就會被髮動。

sentences.english: Workers use flamethrowers to create the desired effects in film production.
sentences.chinese: 在電影製作過程中工作人員用火焰噴射器製造效果。

sentences.english: His gauntlets contain a flamethrower, and a whipcord lanyard launcher.
sentences.chinese: 他的護手裏安裝了火焰噴射器和繩索發射器。
